sn9.10:4.1: At one time one of the mendicants was staying in the land of the Kosalans in a certain forest grove.
sn9.10:4.2: Now at that time that mendicant had previously been spending too much time in recitation. But some time later they adhered to passivity and silence.
sn9.10:4.3: Not hearing the teaching, the deity haunting that forest approached that mendicant,
sn9.10:5.1: “Mendicant, why don’t you recite passages of the teaching,
sn9.10:5.3: When you hear the teaching confidence grows;
sn9.10:5.4: and the reciter’s praised in the present life.”
sn9.10:6.1: “I used to be enthusiastic about passages of the teaching,
sn9.10:6.2: so long as I’d not realized dispassion.
sn9.10:6.3: But then I realized dispassion, which the good call
sn9.10:6.4: the laying to rest by completely understanding
sn9.10:6.5: of whatever is seen, heard, and thought.”
